docs.title: 🧬 Regional Science Newsletter
docs.text:
Welcome to the Regional Science Newsletter — a bi-weekly, community-driven digest sharing:

  • 🧬 Job opportunities
  • 💰 Grants & fellowships
  • 🎤 Seminars & scientific events

All content is curated for scientists in our regional research community.

docs.title: 🗞️ Latest Newsletter
docs.text:
The most recent issue is always listed at the top of the archive:

👉 Go to Newsletter Archive

docs.title: 🔍 Browse by Category
docs.text:
You can explore all shared content here:

  • 🧬 Jobs
  • 💰 Grants
  • 🎤 Seminars
  • 🏷️ Tags (Browse by topic like #plant, #epigenetics, #postdoc)

These pages update automatically as new items are added.

docs.title: ✉️ Subscribe
docs.text:
Want to receive the newsletter by email?

👉 Subscribe here

docs.title: 📖 About This Site
docs.text:
This website serves as:

  • A permanent archive of past newsletters
  • A searchable database of opportunities and events
  • A community resource for staying connected and informed

All listings are linked directly from the original newsletter issues.

Maintained by the Regional Science Newsletter Team.

docs.title: Subscribe
docs.text:
The newsletter is sent bi-weekly and includes:

  • Job openings
  • Funding opportunities
  • Seminars and regional events

✅ Subscription and unsubscription are fully automated.

Mailchimp signup form will be embedded here later.

docs.title: NSF Plant Genome Research Grant
docs.text:
Funding Agency: NSF Program: Plant Genome Research Program (PGRP) Amount: Up to $2,000,000 Deadline: March 5, 2025

Supports genome-scale research in plants.

Funding announcement

docs.title: Test Grant 1
docs.text:
Agency: Test Foundation Amount: $100,000 Deadline: April 1, 2025

This is a test grant for demonstration purposes.

docs.title: Postdoc in Plant Epigenomics – Harvard
docs.text:
Position: Postdoctoral Fellow Field: Plant Epigenomics Institution: Harvard University Deadline: February 15, 2025

Description: Research focuses on chromatin regulation in plant stress responses using CUT&Tag and ATAC-seq.

Apply here
